etymology.description: 𠘧 + 又 — a hand holding a tool similar to a hammer; associated with striking/activity; later borrowed phonetically for a bamboo halberd.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a hand grasping a striking implement, conveying the idea of hitting or manual action. The graph was later reassigned by phonetic loan to name a bamboo halberd, while the original ‘strike/tool’ sense remains visible in its use as a radical.

examples.chinese: 殳姓很少见(殳姓很少見)。
examples.english: The surname Shu is very rare.

examples.chinese: 古书中殳指一种竹制的戟(古書中殳指一種竹製的戟)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔshū zhōng shū zhǐ yī zhǒng zhúzhì de jǐ.
examples.english: In ancient texts, 殳 refers to a kind of bamboo halberd.

examples.chinese: 在甲骨文里，殳像手持工具的形状(在甲骨文裡，殳像手持工具的形狀)。
examples.pinyin: Zài jiǎgǔwén lǐ, shū xiàng shǒuchí gōngjù de xíngzhuàng.
examples.english: In oracle bone script, 殳 looks like a hand holding a tool.
